 The answer is "if you have NOT identified yourself with Jesus then you HAVE chosen against Him." There is no , I simply won't choose.
 
 An example would be if someone hands you a powerball ticket and says it is the winning ticket, then the one who gets the money is the one who believes it and does something, like trying to cash it in. The one who says I don't believe it doesn't do anything and gets nothing. The one who says I don't believe and I don't "not believe" it and therefore does nothing, gets nothing.

 The point is that Not choosing is the same as choosing NOT. It is logically the exact same thing.
 
 I offer you a candy bar. You say I don't want to choose to take it or not take it. The effect is the same as not choosing it. You have no candy bar.
 
 You don't seem to understand that saying "I am not going to choose" is actually making a choice.

 Jesus says in the bible "He who is not with me is against me." We like to think that we come into this life with a clean slate. But that just isn't true. If it was then someone could actually be perfect given perfect parents. Statistically there should be a few given the billions upon billions of people that have existed since the beginning. But there are none. This world is in pretty bad shape due to people. We are broken, bent, dented, use whatever descriptor you want, but it is painfully obvious to anyone paying attention. We come in with a blotched slate. The law given in the bible reveals what actual perfection is and it also reveals that there is no way we can live up to it on our own. Jesus came to give us a way. NOt choosing him leaves you in the same place you started.......Behind.
 
 That is the christian doctrine.
